location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:495 x 411 mm, on sheet 590 x 445 mm.Materials:photocopy on paper.

mods.abstract: Map of Mirjáwa [Mīrjāveh] and surroundings. The map indicates: hydrology; topography, with some indication of relief; cultivated areas; irrigation channels and surface drainage; the positions of the old and new British posts; the position of the ruins of the old village of Mirjáwa. The map is signed by Colonel Arthur Henry McMahon, British Commissioner, Seistan [Sīstān] Arbitration Commission.A printing note in the bottom right corner of the map reads: ‘Heliozincographed at the Survey of India Offices, Calcutta.’
